person.persName: John Baylis Earle (Hopkins County, KY, attorney and coal baron)

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, attorney. Married to Sarah C. Woolfolk Earle. Father of Lucien Earle, Luella Earle, Kittie Earle, Portia Earle, and Augusta Earle. School teacher in 1843. Member of the Whig Party and Republican Party. Assessor of Muhlenburg County, Kentucky. Law student in Hopkins County under the direction of John Cook. Attorney and partner in the law firm of Earle & Waddill, with Otway Waddill, in Madisonville in 1852. Attorney in Madisonville in 1853 to 1859. County attorney for Hopkins County from 1855 to 1859. Attorney in Madisonville in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1860. Founder of Southeast Kentucky Petroleum, Coal, Mining, and Transportation Company, with H. M. Van Arman and Thomas E. Young, in 1865.
